SEARCH
Module org.example.cs130mpfinal
Package org.example.cs130mpfinal

Class QuineMcCluskeyCalculator

java.lang.Object
org.example.cs130mpfinal.QuineMcCluskeyCalculator
public class QuineMcCluskeyCalculator extends Object
The QuineMcCluskeyCalculator class provides functionality for simplifying Boolean functions using the Quine-McCluskey (Tabular) Method.
Since:
2024-03-20
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Arianne Jayne Acosta, Christian Jesse Bonifacio

    • QuineMcCluskeyCalculator

      public QuineMcCluskeyCalculator(String mintermsStr)
      Constructor for initializing the Quine-McCluskey calculator.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • convertString

      private int[] convertString(String s)
      Converts the minterms string input and checks if valid.
      Parameters:
      s - A valid string containing the minterms to be solved.
      Returns:
      Integer array with minterms parsed from string input.

    • group

      private ArrayList<Term>[] group(Term[] terms)
      Groups an array of terms based on their number of ones.
      Parameters:
      terms - Array of terms to be grouped.
      Returns:
      Array of array lists of terms where each element represents a group of terms with the same number of ones.

    • solve

      public void solve()
      First stage of solution using Quine-McCluskey method. Main solver method of the class to be called.

    • solveSecond

      public void solveSecond()
      Second stage of solution using Quine-McCluskey method. Recursively calls itself if there are still remaining minterms.

    • checkValidity

      boolean checkValidity(Term term1, Term term2)
      Check if two terms are already valid for grouping.
      Parameters:
      term1 - The first term to be checked.
      term2 - The second term to be checked.
      Returns:
      True if grouping is possible, else false if not.

    • contains

      boolean contains(Term term1, Term term2)
      Check if two terms have all their numbers present in another term.
      Parameters:
      term1 - The first term to be the basis of checking.
      term2 - The second term to be checked for presence of numbers in term1.
      Returns:
      True if term1 contains all its numbers present in term2, else false.

    • simplify

      void simplify()
      Simplifies the solution done on the object using Petrick's method.

    • multiply

      HashSet<String> multiply(HashSet<String>[] p, int k)
      Multiplies elements from sets at indices adjacent to each other in the Hash set array and recursively computes for the product.
      Parameters:
      p - Array of Hash sets containing elements to be multiplied.
      k - Index pointing to the first set to be multiplied.
      Returns:
      A Hash set resulting from the multiplication of adjacent sets in a Hash set array.

    • mix

      String mix(String str1, String str2)
      Mixes terms and simplifies those that are duplicated with respect to properties of boolean expressions.
      Parameters:
      str1 - The first string to be multiplied.
      str2 - The second string to be multiplied.
      Returns:
      A string containing the simplified boolean product of both input strings.

    • identifyPrimeImplicants

      private boolean identifyPrimeImplicants()
      Identify prime implicants, add them to primeImplicants array list, and remove from minterms and finalTerms array lists.
      Returns:
      True if prime implicants are identified, else false.

    • columnDominance

      private boolean columnDominance()
      Identify dominating columns and remove them from the minterms and finalTerms array lists.
      Returns:
      True if there are dominating columns and were identified and removed, else false.

    • rowDominance

      private boolean rowDominance()
      Identify dominating rows and remove them from the minterms and finalTerms array lists.
      Returns:
      True if there are dominating rows and were identified and removed, else false.

    • toStandardForm

      String toStandardForm(String s)

    • printResults

      public String printResults(String[] variables)
      Build a String for the final resulting solutions to be presented to the user.
      Parameters:
      variables - List of variables that contains corresponding variable names.
      Returns:
      The String build-up of the final resulting solutions.
